title: Modeling a Non-Periodic Context - Logarithmic Function Part C

content.question: Part C The leaders of the study decide to use model \(R\) to make predictions about the group’s score beyond \(12\) months (\(1\) year). For a given year, model \(R\) is an appropriate model if the group’s predicted score at the end of the year is at least \(1\) point lower than the group’s predicted score at the end of the previous year. Based on this information, for how many years is model \(R\) an appropriate model? Give a reason for your answer. (Note: The end of a year occurs every \(12\) months from the initial evaluation—<math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>12</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIXaGaaGOmaaaa@39BF@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>24</mn> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiaadshacqGH9aqpcaaIYaGaaGinaaaa@39C2@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mo>…</mo> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbdfgBPjMCPbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacH8Xr=y0tbbg9q8qqaqpepec8Eeeq0tXdbba9frFj0=OqFL0dbba9LqpC0db9Fve9pce9v8qqaq=dir=xirpG0tb9fr=xfr=xfrpeWZqaaeaabiGaciaacaqabeaadaqaaqaaaOqaaiablAcilbaa@376B@</annotation> </semantics> </math>)

topic.text: 1.13: Function Model Selection and Assumption Articulation

skill.text: Skill 3.C: Support conclusions or choices with a logical rationale or appropriate data.
